alert.note: Alert for Cochise; Pima; Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 11:28PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Arizona and Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, in South Central Arizona, Pima. In Southeast Arizona, Cochise and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whetstone, Huachuca City, St. David, Elgin, Fort Huachuca, Kartchner Caverns State Park, Parker Canyon Lake, Canelo and Fairbank. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
